intro: Andinia trimytera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on long, slender stalks. Andinia trimytera is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
